subject: Law
title: Why Constitutions Exist
description: Learn Why Constitutions Exist in one minute.

hook.text: Before constitutions, rulers could change laws on a whim. One bad king could erase centuries of progress.

buildup.text: A constitution is a supreme rulebook that limits government power and protects individual rights.

discovery.text: It sits above all other laws. Any law that contradicts it can be struck down as invalid.

twist.text: But a constitution is only paper. It works because people agree to follow itâ€”and fight when it's violated.

climax.text: That shared agreement is called constitutional legitimacy. Without it, the document is meaningless.

punchline.text: A constitution is a nation's promise to itself.

quiz.question: What gives a constitution its real power?
options: The collective agreement to follow it
